subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_01E1_01C9E844.6671E450
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

This seems to jive with what I have learned this far, but I am still not ce=
rtain I understand it completely.

I thought everything was based in the el=
ectromagnetic spectrum.

----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Frank Ratka =

  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 2:05 PM
  Sub=
ject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas





        Tell me where the seperation on =
the spectrum takes place between 300Hz and 300KHz. Yes, soundwaves cause pr=
essure waves that our ears read as vibration and our mind translates as sou=
nd. The waves are still on the electromagnetic spectrum. Even subsonic geom=
agnetic waves are present on the scale. What I mean by power can be directl=
l translated to volume or amplitude. The only thing that distinguishes soun=
dwaves from any other wave is the fact that we can hear them.

        Fran=
k R.

        --- On Mon, 6/8/09, Rj <rasterer@...> wrote:


        =
  From: Rj <rasterer@...>
          Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
=
          To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
          Date: Monday, June 8, 2009,=
 2:53 PM


                No. Sounds waves are not on the electromagnet sp=
ectrum nor are they a form of electromagnet energy. Sound waves are based o=
n pressure waves in the air (or in other substances).  Our ears detect thes=
e pressure waves and translate them into sounds we here.  Our ear do NOT he=
ar electromagnet energy.  Our eyes do: that part which we call visible ligh=
t.



                --- On Mon, 6/8/09, Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@ yahoo.=
com> wrote:


                  From: Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@ yahoo.com>=

                  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
                  To: E=
VP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
                  Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 12:38=
 PM


                        It sounds like she's saying "one, two, ....."=


                        A mistake that a lot of people make is thinking t=
hat there are two different types of energy at work when it comes to sound =
waves and electromagnetic waves. The only thing that seperates them is freq=
uency and power. Radio waves are radio waves because they occupy a certain =
block of the electromagnietic spectrum. Sound waves exist on that same spec=
trum just farther down with much longer waves. Soundwaves and subsonic wave=
s can penetrate almost anything because of their wavelengths. The shorter t=
he wavelength the more ways we can shield against them.

                  =
      Think of microwaves. These are also a type of radio and telemetry tra=
nsmitting wave but the waves also have a physical effect on our environment=
 by causing molecules to speed up, which creates heat. A little lower than =
this is IR or infrared it too can cause physical objects to heat up but usu=
ally it just causes molecules to rotate in place. All physical things give =
off IR light. Its a way the total system conserves energy by spontaneously =
emitting IR radiation.

                        Frank R.

                 =
       --- On Mon, 6/8/09, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresear=
ch. com> wrote:


                          From: April Abercrombie <april@=
abercrombiegh ostresearch. com>
                          Subject: Re: [EVP=
-ITC] New ideas [3 Attachments]
                          To: EVP-ITC@yahoo=
groups .com
                          Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 2:27 PM

=

                          Here is some food for thought. I am currently re=
viewing my audio from our May 30th investigation.

                        =
  It was me and another girl teammate present in the room. I picked up a 3r=
d female voice on my digital voice recorder that I carry with me. We were s=
tanding right next to another digital video recorder that I leave beside my=
 night vision camera. That recorder did not pick up this 3rd voice. I have =
asked the girl that was with me to check her recording to see if she picked=
 it up.

                          I have long felt the true EVP does not c=
ome from sound waves in the environment, or then it wouldn't be EVP, but a =
disembodied voice. Somehow EVP's are appearing directly on the recordings.
=

                          This instance with the recorders may back that t=
heory up. That other recorder should have picked that voice up if it were s=
ound waves in the environment.

                          I am attaching th=
e clip of this 3rd voice. The file that is named "01-02-17 Clip" is the ful=
l clip. You will hear my voice as I say "Yeah", and then another comes in r=
ight after that. I think I know what it says.

                          Ag=
ain, I was live monitoring my audio, but still did not hear this until play=
back. It isn't clear, so I am not as excited about it as my one's from the =
last investigation.


                            ----- Original Message --=
--- 
                            From: Frank Ratka 
                       =
     To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
                            Sent: Monday=
, June 08, 2009 1:09 PM
                            Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] =
New ideas


                                I have a running theory that EV=
P is carried on an untrasonic wave and demodulated exactly where they want =
it to manifest. It works off the heterodyne principle. If you mix two ultra=
sonic waves that differ one another in frequency then if you add or subtrac=
t them together you get a beat frequency or alternate frequency. For exampl=
e, if a ghost is sending a signal at 54KHz and you have an electric fan in =
a room creating an untrasonic frequency at 45KHz then you will have a inter=
mediate difference frequency at 9KHz, well within human hearing range (20Hz=
 to 20KHz). This was just an example, but all electronic equipment generate=
s ultrasonic signals just by turning them on. From this theory I always fel=
t that EVP were generated within a few inches of the recorder.

           =
                     We are able to reproduce this affect in not only radio=
 with superheterodyne systems but also with acoustics and audio as in some =
passive sonars and a commercial produce called the "audio spotlight" by Dr.=
 Joseph Pompeii.

                                Frank R.

               =
                 --- On Mon, 6/8/09, Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@gmail. com> wrot=
e:


                                From: Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@gmail. com=
>
                                Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
        =
                        To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
                      =
          Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 1:56 PM


                           =
     Fascinating! I've had this idea that the EVP are often not recorded by=
 the microphone but somehow make their way in at the actual point where the=
 storage is made, whether it be analog (tape) or digital. 

               =
                 So much we don't know ...

                               =
 Zack

                                 
                                On=
 Mon, Jun 8, 2009 at 1:39 PM, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostres=
earch. com> wrote:




                                I monitor my audio l=
ive. The funny thing is that even so, those last EVP's I captured I did not=
 hear either in the environment, or on my recording as it happened. I only =
heard them upon playback.

                                ----- Original M=
essage ----- 
                                From: Zack Widup 
           =
                     To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
                        =
        Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 11:40 AM
                              =
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas


                                I am c=
urious if anyone with a microphone wired to a remote site has ever gotten a=
ny EVP in real time.

                                I took part in an inv=
estigation of Ashmore Estates, near Ashmore IL, on Saturday night. We had s=
ix video cameras set up in the three halls of the building. The video for a=
ll was being monitored and recorded at a central location. Alas, we did not=
 have microphones at the camera sites conected to the central location. I w=
onder what we might have heard if we did?

                                =
Zack

                                 
                                On =
Mon, Jun 8, 2009 at 12:05 PM, threadsintyme@ juno.com <Threadsintyme@ juno.=
com> wrote:


                                Let's just agree to end this =
discussion about her... 
                                Why don't we discu=
ss something on a lighter note? Anyone have any new ideas about either evp =
or ITC? 
                                Al

                              =
